return {
    type: "checkbox",
    label: "Show Points: ",
    horizontal: true,
    value: true,
    key: "showPoints"
}

return {
	type: "dropdown",
	label: "X Axis Scale: ",
	entries: ["linear","logarithmic"],
	value: "category",
	key: "xAxisScale"
}

content.text: Chart Test
Input Data
The following cells give input data to populate the charts.
Chart Form Development
The following form is a sandbox for developing the chart form.
Right now I only have the form portion, not the choice of which type of input to use.
I have configured it as an action form so I could take the output and convert it into a function body and send it to another cell.
The following cell receives the output from the above form on submission.
This is a quick and dirty remap to put the config json in the proper form:
Output Chart
Time Sample
Below is some data for testing time series.
Line Graph
Here we develop the forms for the line graph input.
Chart Config
This is the form for the overall chart configuration.
X Values (checkbox) [Category,Numeric]
X Categories (textField, expression) {for X values = category}
This is the form from the chart layout.
The following table receives the translated output from the lineGraphForm.
Here we must manually paste the "code" from above into the formula for the cell below. This function body should execute to return the config json for the chart.
Below we process the above configuration into the proper input for the chart.
And here is the resulting chart.
Chart Config Components
Data Series
The user can enter a number of data series. Each has the following layout.
Data
Numeric Data
Data Type (dropdown) [XValues and YValues, XY Points, Data Array and XY Accessors] {for X values = numeric}
X Value Array (text field, expression) {for Data Type = XValues and YValues}
Y Values Array (text field, expression) {for Data Type = X Value and Y Values} and {X Values = category}
Point Array (text field, expression) {for Data Type = XY Points}
Data Array (text field, expression) {for Data Type = Data Array and XY Accessors}
X Accessor (text field, expression) {for Data Type = Data Array and XY Accessors}
Y Accessor (text field, expression) {for Data Type = Data Array and XY Accessors}
Category Data
This is the data series input for category data. Category data must be input as a common x category array for all the data series.
Data Type (dropdown) [YValues, Data Array and Y Accessors] {for X values = category}
Y Values Array (text field, expression) {X Values = category}
Data Array (text field, expression) {for Data Type = Data Array and Y Accessor}
Y Accessor (text field, expression) {for Data Type = Data Array and Y Accessor}
Series Options
These are the options for the series.
Chart Options
These are the general options for the chart.
Additional Notes On Values
"Coupled" values:
set pointHoverRadius to be the same as pointRadius (or bigger?)
set pointHoverBorderWidth to be the same and pointBorderWidth (or bigger)
Future additions:
multiple axes
y category values
General Config
This section has general config options.
Title
The layout configures the title of the chart.
Legend
This layout configures the layout of the chart.
Elements
These layouts configure the different elements of the chart. They are used as needed depending on the tyep of chart.
For these, the layouts are typically repeated for the series, so you can customize the series individually or provide common configurations.
Point
Point Style (dropdown) [default,none,circle,cross,crossRot,dash,rect,rectRounded,rectRot,star,triangle]
Point Size (dropdown) [default,size list?]
Point Color (dropdown) [default,auto,color list]
Point Weight (drodown) [default,1,2,3,5,7,10]
NOTE: I have the name "size" for radius. I might want to divide size by 2 to get radius.
Line
Line Color (dropdown) [auto,color list]
Line Width (dropdown) [default,1,2,3,5,7,10]
Area Fill (checkbox) [none,fill]
Fill Color (dropdown) [auto,colors] {for Area Fill = true}
- Fill Opacity (slider) {for Area Fill = true}
add these:
Line Tension (checkbox) [default,select]
- (slider) {disable if line tension not selected?}
Span Gaps (dropdown) [default,true,false]
Stepped Lines [default, false, leading,centered,trailing]
Rectangle
Axes
In the future we should add multiple axes for x or y. For now there is just one for each.
X Axis
This entry is only needed when the the data is numeric. There is currently no config for type category.
The following element should be used if we need to switch on the x value type.
And this element should be used if there is no x value type element, and the x value type is numeric.
Here is the form with the element
Y Axis
Currently Y axis is always numeric.
Input Data
The following cells give input data to populate the charts.
